page.title: 02ALSTON MOOR'S ADMINISTRATION
page.content: {Alston Moor}is within the parliamentary constituency of{Penrith {and the Borders.}It is represented by a County Councillor on{Cumbria County {Council }and returns two members of { {Eden District Council.}Since local government re-organisation in 1974 there has been a Parish Council which meets monthly and accepts responsibility for local matters such as footpaths, seats, the sports field and for the Town Hall as Trustees.{The {Parish Council }levies a local rate.{ {The East Fellside and Alston Moor {Project}has promoted tourism and small craft industries. Pamphlets have been published detailing walks on thr area.{Manpower Services Commission}has funded schemes to cap the many open mine-shafts and to renovate the Fairhill Recreation Ground.In 1985 a {Y.T.S.'Enterprise'scheme}was launched.
